H0.text: when did the united states became a nation. 1787

H1.text: when did the united states became a nation. 1783

H2.text: when did the united states became a nation. 1791

H3.text: when did the united states became a nation. 1776

A4.text: The Declaration of Independence, formally The unanimous Declaration of the thirteen united States of America in the original printing, is the founding document of the United States. On July 4, 1776, it was adopted unanimously by the Second Continental Congress

A5.text: Historian George Athan Billias says: 'Independence amounted to a new status of interdependence: the United States was now a sovereign nation entitled to the privileges and responsibilities that came with that status.'
